original_title: Sri Lanka shares gain in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares edge up in mid day trade on Wednesday, as confidence on domestic debt restructuring and optimization continue, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was up 0.91 percent or 85.43 points to 9,454.34, while the most liquid index S&P was up 1.23 percent or 33.02 points to 2,727.94.
Sri Lanka domestic debt restructuring (DDR) will not affect the stability of any public or private bank or the member balance of any provident funds, President Ranil Wickremesinghe has said.
Sri Lanka will announce its DDR this week amid market speculations over instability in financial and banking sectors.
However, Wickremesinghe, speaking at an event in Gampaha district said that the DDR “will have no impact on the membership balance of any public funds, including the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF)”.
The market generated a turnover of 1.5 billion rupees at 1230 hours.
Top gainers during mid day trade were Sampath Bank, Browns Investment & Commercial Bank. (Colombo/June28/2023)
